intro: Sanicula ichangensis, commonly known as the Chinese sanicle, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
